content: How can I help you today?

I've been having a lot of trouble sleeping lately. My mind just won't stop racing when I go to bed, and I end up using my phone to distract myself, but I know that's probably making it worse. It's just been a rough time lately because of work, and I feel like I'm drowning in stress.

It sounds like you’ve been going through a lot right now with work stress, and that's been impacting your ability to get the rest you need. Using your phone might feel like it helps in the moment, but you’re also aware it might not be the best for your sleep. You seem torn between looking for relief and wanting healthier ways to handle things. What has this been like for you?

It's been exhausting, honestly. I'm constantly worried about my job and how I'll provide for my family if I get fired. I try to distract myself, but those thoughts just keep coming back. And then I wake up the next day even more tired and overwhelmed. It's like a cycle I can't break.

That sounds incredibly draining—carrying the weight of worry about your job and your family while trying to push through the exhaustion each day. It seems like you’re stuck in a cycle that adds to your stress, and yet you’re trying to find ways to manage those racing thoughts. It’s clear how important your family and your responsibilities are to you. What have you tried so far to break the cycle, if anything?

Honestly, I haven’t done much other than scrolling on my phone to distract myself. I know it’s not helping, but it’s hard to stop. I guess I’ve just been hoping it’ll get better on its own, but it hasn’t.

It can be tough to make changes when you’re already feeling overwhelmed—you’ve been doing what you can to get through the moment, even though you recognize it hasn’t helped long-term. You seem open to acknowledging that things haven’t improved the way you hoped. What do you think might make a difference for you right now?

I’m not really sure what would help at this point. Maybe if I could find a better way to quiet my mind at night or feel less stressed about work during the day, that could make a difference. But I don’t even know where to start with that.

You’re feeling stuck, but you’re also starting to explore the idea of finding ways to calm your mind and manage your stress—those sound like steps you’d like to take if you could. It’s understandable to feel unsure of where to begin when the stress feels so big. What do you think it might look like if you were able to manage work stress better or quiet your mind at night?

I think it would feel like a weight lifted off my shoulders. If I could go to bed without my thoughts racing or feeling like I’m already behind the next day, I think I’d be able to sleep better—maybe even feel more present for my family the next day. It just feels so far away from where I am right now.

That image of having the weight lifted and being more present for your family sounds really meaningful for you. It’s clear how much you care about being there for them and finding relief from all this pressure. Even though it feels far away right now, the fact that you’re thinking about what could be better shows that this matters deeply to you. What do you think has been holding you back from getting closer to that feeling?

I guess it’s partly just feeling overwhelmed and not knowing where to start. And honestly, I don’t know if I believe anything will really help. It’s hard to imagine things getting better when everything feels so out of control right now.

Feeling overwhelmed and unsure about whether change is even possible can make it really hard to take that first step—it makes sense why it feels like a challenge. Your stress has been a lot to carry, and when things feel out of control, it can be hard to trust that things can shift. But you're here now, thinking about what could be different, which is a powerful step in itself. What would it mean for you if you were able to regain even a small sense of control or relief?

I guess it would mean that I’d feel less stuck, you know? Like, maybe I could handle things a bit better or at least not feel so weighed down all the time. Even a small difference feels like it could go a long way right now.

That hope for even a small change sounds really important to you—it’s about feeling less stuck and starting to move toward something lighter, more manageable. You’re recognizing how even small steps could open up some relief, which is a thoughtful way of looking at things. Is there any small step that feels like it might be a good place to try and start, or one that feels less intimidating right now?

Maybe I could try putting my phone down earlier at night, even though that feels really hard. I don’t know how I’d stop my thoughts, but maybe just starting with something small like that could be a step. It’s just hard to know if it’ll actually make a difference.

Deciding to try putting your phone down earlier is a thoughtful small step—it’s challenging but feels like something within your reach right now. Even though you’re unsure if it’ll make a difference yet, you’re giving yourself a chance to explore what might work for you. Would it help to think through ways to make that step feel more doable or to think about what could support you while trying it out?

I guess it might help to have something else to focus on instead, like maybe reading a book or something calming? But honestly, I feel like my mind is still going to race no matter what I do, so I’m not sure how much it’ll help.

Finding something calming, like reading a book, could be a good replacement for your phone, giving your mind a softer focus. At the same time, you’re aware your racing thoughts might still make it feel challenging, and that concern makes sense given everything you’re juggling. Even if those thoughts are still present, trying something different might be a way to test if even a small change can bring a little relief. How would you feel about giving it a try for a few nights and seeing how it feels?

I think I’d be willing to give it a try, but I’m still skeptical if it’ll make a difference. I guess trying can’t really make things worse, though. Maybe I’ll pick up a book tonight and see how it goes.

You're showing a lot of courage by being willing to give this a try, even though you're feeling skeptical—it's not easy to take that step when doubts are present. Testing out reading tonight is a thoughtful way to start, and it sounds like you're open to seeing how even small changes might feel. Is there anything else you'd want to explore or talk about before moving forward with this idea?
